Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cecropin A(1-8)-Magainin 2(4-12) hybrid peptide (CE-MA) (Lys-rich; CAMEL; synthetic AMPs20, UCLL; BBL)

Literature Information.Literature: Structure:  Lysine rich (41.2%). Alpha helix 5 to 13 in DPC micelles.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB. CAMEL (seq: KWKLFKKIGAVLKVL) is also a hybrid peptide obtained by combining residues 1-7 of cecropin (CA) and residues 2-9 of melittin (M). D-form tends to more active and more stable than the L-form (D>L). Transgenic plants: expression of this peptide in tobacco or potato led to disease-resistant plants against bacteria and fungi (ref). Another hybrid CA(1-8)M(1-18) is active against P. falciparum.
Literature Information.Author: Oh H, Hedberg M, Wade D, Edlund C.
Literature Information.Title: Activities of synthetic hybrid peptides against anaerobic bacteria: aspects of methodology and stability
